H0.text: They change water into heat is how plants use the energy they receive from sunlight.

H1.text: They produce their own food is how plants use the energy they receive from sunlight.

H2.text: They make minerals for their roots is how plants use the energy they receive from sunlight.

H3.text: They break down nutrients into rocks is the best description of how plants use the energy they receive from sunlight.

A4.text: Photosynthesis ( FOH-tə-SINTH-ə-sis) is a system of biological processes by which photopigment-bearing autotrophic organisms, such as most plants, algae and cyanobacteria, convert light energy — typically from sunlight — into the chemical energy necessary to fuel their metabolism.

A5.text: Plants convert light into chemical energy with a photosynthetic efficiency of 3–6%.
